intro: Desmodium triquetrum subsp. alatum, commonly known as the winged milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It is a perennial legume characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical pods that contain several seeds, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to arid environments. The species is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
